intro: Mesembryanthemum albescens, commonly known as the white mesem, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers that open in response to sunlight. The plant features pale green to white foliage with a waxy coating, adapted to store water in arid environments. Its flowers are typically small and white or pale pink, blooming in the early morning. Mesembryanthemum albescens is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
